channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2367] Why Doesnt Facebook Look Like This?
item.description: As you may be aware, tomorrow, Facebook kicks off its big f8 developer conference in San Francisco. We'll be there to cover what's going on, but it looks like a lot of the information is already out there -- Inside Facebook, All Facebook, and GigaOM have good write-ups of what we can likely expect. We've previously reported on a bunch of these poss

item.title: [+1744] Steve Jobs: “Folks who want porn can buy an Android phone”
item.description: Apple CEO Steve Jobs is on a roll. While he's probably had better days than today, he's lately been shooting off emails left and right in response to customers' concerns. We just were sent what appears to be one such Jobs response, sent last week surrounding the whole Mark Fiore situation. And it's a good one.When questioned about Apple's role

item.title: [+1679] We want to stop the sexualising of children? (PIC)
item.description: Maybe we should start here..

item.title: [+1590] What 10,000 Women Really Think
item.description: Nearly ten thousand woman shared their politics, finances, sex lives, and knowledge of former college football coaches.

item.title: [+1528] YouTube Removes Hitler/"Downfall" Parodies
item.description: The movie studio responsible for the award-winning, German-Austrian film Downfall (German: Der Untergang) has asked YouTube to take down several videos from the massively popular subtitled “Hitler finds out…” meme, and the site has complied.

item.title: [+1389] Washed Up Whale Found with Gallons of Our Garbage In Its Gut
item.description: A young 37-foot whale stranded on the shore in West Seattle, and it had a summary of what we're doing to our oceans held within its stomach.

item.title: [+1190] Marijuana Is Safer, So Why Are We Driving People To Drink?

item.title: [+1009] Why More U.S. Expatriates Are Turning In Their Passports
item.description: Hit with double taxation and snubbed by local banks, more and more Americans abroad are choosing to give up their citizenship

item.title: [+998] U.S. Realeases New $100 Bill (pics)
item.description: The U.S. Treasury refreshes its currency every once in a while to stay a step ahead of counterfeiters, and this time they’re refreshing the $100 bill.

item.title: [+998] Jon Stewart on Goldman's Sachs's Fraud Charges
item.description: The Daily Show takes a closer look at the SEC's charges against the big bank, and analyzes Jim Cramer's "insider" information which pegged G-Sachs as a "winner."

item.title: [+960] Palin: "Obama's handeling of volcano helps terrorist"
item.description: When asked if Volcano's could form a threat to the united states she implied Obama's handling of the matter might just make things worse: "He hasn't come right out and threatened violence on Eyjafjallajokull. Who calls a shot like that? Who makes a decision like that? It's a disturbing trend."

item.title: [+906] Bring Your Children To Work Day Fail
item.description: When I grow up, I want to be a bar gymnast just like Mommy!

item.title: [+901] Tokyo Drift: The Early Years (PIC)
item.description: Too fast...too furious.

item.title: [+817] Botched McAfee update shutting down XP machines worldwide!
item.description: It's the AVocalypse! A bad McAfee for Windows XP update is causing computers worldwide to shut down. Twitter is basically going nuts, and McAfee's support site appears to be down.

item.title: [+803] Online Gaming Statistics [Graphic]
item.description: Gamers around the world have contributed Billions of $$$$ to the gaming industry and its still growing. You think they’re middle aged men who still live in their parents basement... Think again!

item.title: [+775] 14 Amusing 'Unattended Children' Warning Signs
item.description: If only the owners of the establishments displaying these funny 'unattended children' warning signs could carry out their threats for real...

item.title: [+673] 14 Things You Might Not Know About The Big Lebowski
item.description: Not all movies stand the test of time. Viewers have the memory span of goldfish and what’s hot today may soon be forgotten. Cult classics, on the other hand, often become immortal. The Big Lebowski (1998) is such a film.

item.title: [+663] 'Clockwork Orange killers' beat gay man to death
item.description: Two teenage girls kicked a homosexual man to death as he lay unconscious in Trafalgar Square in a shocking killing likened to a scene from the movie Clockwork Orange, the Old Bailey heard.Ruby Thomas and Rachel Burke, both 18, stamped on Ian Baynham's chest and kicked him in the head after their friend Joel Alexander, 19, punched him to the ground,

item.title: [+660] xkcd: Circuit Diagram
item.description: I just caught myself idly trying to work out what that resistor mass would actually be, and realized I had self-nerd-sniped

item.title: [+651] Jamie Oliver: Taking the food revolution to the president
item.description: If Jamie Oliver can't persuade the school lunch ladies of Huntington, West Virginia, that fresh food is better than processed, maybe he'll have better luck with President Barack Obama.
